intro: Cacalia triantha, commonly known as the three-flowered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, three-lobed flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Cacalia triantha is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
